H0.text: The nervous and muscle systems are the body systems most involved in the response when someone stubs his or her toe.

H1.text: Muscle and endocrine systems are the most involved in the response when someone stubs his or her toe.

H2.text: The nervous and digestive systems are the body systems most involved in the response when someone stubs his or her toe.

H3.text: Reproductive and circulatory are the body systems most involved in the response when someone stubs his or her toe.

A4.text: The circuit begins with sensory receptors in the skin that are activated by harmful levels of heat: a special type of molecular structure embedded in the membrane causes heat to change the electrical field across the membrane.

A5.text: The interneurons excite the motor neurons, and if the excitation is strong enough, some of the motor neurons generate action potentials, which travel down their axons to the point where they make excitatory synaptic contacts with muscle cells.
